Meissners corpuscle.Definition: Meissner's corpuscles are encapsulated nerve endings of dorsal root ganglion cells.  They are located in skin, which consist of flattened supportive cells arranged as horizontal lamellae surrounded by a connective tissue capsule, that function as mechanoreceptors for light touch. The corpuscle is between 30-140 μm in length and 40-60 μm in diameter.
